pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:0.5: 6. The training rule on exchanging what belongs to the Sangha
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.2: At that time the lay followers collected voluntary contributions with the aim of supplying robes for the Sangha of nuns, and then stored the equipment in the house of a cloth merchant. They went to the nuns and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.3: “Venerables, equipment to be used for robes is stored in the house of such-and-such a cloth merchant. Please have someone get cloth from that and then share it out.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.4: But the nuns exchanged that equipment for tonics, which they then used.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.5: When the lay followers found out about this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.6: “When equipment belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, how can the nuns exchange it for something else?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.7: The nuns heard the complaints of those lay followers,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.8: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.9: “When equipment belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, how can the nuns exchange it for something else?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.13: “… When equipment belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, how can the nuns exchange it for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.15: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.16: ‘When equipment belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.5: Equipment […] designated for a specific purpose:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.6: it was given for a specific purpose.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.8: belonging to the Sangha, not to a group, not to an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.10: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.11: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.12: It is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.13: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.14: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.15: … ‘Venerables, this thing which I got in exchange for equipment belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.1: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is for a specific purpose, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.2: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure if it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.3: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is for a specific purpose, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.4: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.5: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is for a specific purpose, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.6: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.7: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is for a specific purpose, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.2: if she makes use of the remainder;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.3: if she makes use of it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.6: The sixth training rule is finished.
